Package Datastructures.Theory

Class EquivalenceClasses

java.lang.Object
Datastructures.Theory.EquivalenceClasses
public class EquivalenceClasses extends Object
This class manages lists of equivalence classes of literals. It operates in two modes:
Initial phase: analysis of the input clauses.
Search phase: parallel to the solvers, as thread.
Initial phase:
It is called after the unit clauses are put into the model. The input ist: 1. the model with the initial unit clauses.
2. the basic equivalence clauses one by one.
The literals in the equivalence clauses are analysed and new equivalence classes are generated. New unit clauses are put into the model.
Search phase as thread:
It gets its input from the model and from the TwoLiteral module.
Equivalences are stored as clauses with sorted literals The first literal (with the smallest predicate) is the representative of the equivalence class.
The representative is always positive.

    • problemSupervisor

      public final ProblemSupervisor problemSupervisor

    • statistics

      public EquivalenceStatistics statistics
      for collecting statistics

    • trackReasoning

      public final boolean trackReasoning
      controls the computation of the clause's origins

    • problemId

      private final String problemId
      The id of the current problem to be solved

    • clauses

      private final ArrayList<Clause> clauses
      The list of Equivalence clauses

    • literalIndex

      private final HashMap<Integer,CLiteral> literalIndex
      maps literals to the literal occurrences in clauses. It exploits that equivalence classes are disjoint. Therefore a literal can occur in only a single equivalence clause.

    • model

      public final Model model
      the global model of true literals

    • symboltable

      public Symboltable symboltable
      null or a the global symboltable

    • monitor

      private MonitorLife monitor
      for logging the actions of this class

    • monitoring

      private boolean monitoring
      indicates monitoring is on

    • monitorId

      private String monitorId
      for distinguishing the monitoring areas

    • nextId

      private IntSupplier nextId
      for computing the next clause id

    • queue

      private final PriorityBlockingQueue<Task<EquivalenceClasses.TaskType>> queue
      A queue of newly derived unit literals and binary equivalences. The unit literals are automatically put at the beginning of the queue.

    • observers

      private final ArrayList<Consumer<Clause>> observers
      These observers are called for new equivalences: (representative,literal,origins) They are not called for the initial basic equivalence clauses.

    • EquivalenceClasses

  • Method Details

    • getPriority

      private int getPriority(Task<EquivalenceClasses.TaskType> task)
      gets the priority for the objects in the queue.
      Parameters:
      task - the task in the queue
      Returns:
      the priority of the objects in the queue.

    • addObserver

      public void addObserver(Consumer<Clause> observer)
      Any solver which is interested to know about newly derived equivalences can add an observer. The observer is called with (literal1, literal2, origins) as soon as new equivalences literal1 == literal2 are derived.
      Parameters:
      observer - a TriConsumer for transferring newly derived equivalences.

    • configure

      public void configure()
      adds the observer to the model. Must be called before the thread is started.

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts the instance in a thread. The thread waits for newly derived unit clauses (via the model) and newly derived equivalences (via the TwoLiteral module) and integrates them into the equivalence classes. During this process, new unit clauses and new equivalences may be derived. The unit clauses are transferred to the model, and the equivalences are made available by the equivalenceObservers.
      The loop can only be stopped by an interrupt or a contradiction.
      The result is stored into the variable result.

    • addBasicEquivalenceClause

      public void addBasicEquivalenceClause(int[] basicClause) throws Unsatisfiable
      adds a basic equivalence basicClause to the equivalence classes. All literals are replaced by the representatives of already existing equivalence classes. Double occurrences are ignored.
      A contradiction may occur, if for example p,-q is to be added to p,q.
      In this case an Unsatisfiable exception is thrown.
      If the new equivalence class overlaps with the one, the two are joined.
      Parameters:
      basicClause - a basic equivalence basicClause
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable - if a contradictory truth value has been discovered.

    • addTrueLiteral

      public void addTrueLiteral(int literal, InferenceStep inference)
      adds a true literal to the queue
      Parameters:
      literal - a true literal
      inference - which caused the truth

    • addDerivedEquivalence

      public void addDerivedEquivalence(int literal1, int literal2, InferenceStep inferenceStep) throws Unsatisfiable
      This method is to be called by the TwoLiteral module to announce a newly derived equivalence literal1 = literal2. The equivalences is put into the queue.
      Parameters:
      literal1 - a literal
      literal2 - an equivalent literal
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable

    • integrateEquivalence

      public void integrateEquivalence(Clause clause, boolean derived) throws Unsatisfiable
      integrates a clause into the equivalence classes. Literals are replaced by representatives of other equivalence classes (if necessary)
      True and false literals cause all equivalent literals to become true/false
      Double literals are removed.
      Complementary literals cause Unsatisfiable to be thrown.
      Overlapping equivalences are joined to the new clause (the clauses are removed).
      All observers are applied to derived clauses.
      Parameters:
      clause - a new equivalence clause
      derived - is true if the clause is a derived clause (not basic)
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable

    • normalizeClause

      protected Clause normalizeClause(Clause clause) throws Unsatisfiable
      performs a number of transformations and simplifications. replaces literals by representatives in some equivalence class
      checks for true/false literals
      checks for double literals p,p (p becomes false)
      checks for inconsistencies p == -p
      Parameters:
      clause - a disjointness clause
      Returns:
      null or the normalized clause
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable - if a contradiction is discovered.

    • checkForComplementaries

      protected void checkForComplementaries(Clause clause) throws Unsatisfiable
      replaces all double literals and checks for inconsistency.
      Parameters:
      clause - a clause
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable - if the clause contains a contradiction p = -p

    • checkTruthValues

      protected Clause checkTruthValues(Clause clause) throws Unsatisfiable
      a true/false literal causes all equivalent literals to become true/false,
      Parameters:
      clause - the original not integrated clause
      Returns:
      null (true clause) or the unchanged clause
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable

    • joinClause

      protected Clause joinClause(Clause clause) throws Unsatisfiable
      joins the new (not inserted) equivalence clause with overlapping old clauses If there are overlappings then the clauses are removed from the internal data structures.
      Parameters:
      clause - A new equivalence clause
      Returns:
      the extended new clause
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable - if a contradiction p = -p occurs.

    • integrateTrueLiteral

      protected void integrateTrueLiteral(int literal) throws Unsatisfiable
      A true literal causes all other equivalent literals to become true.
      Parameters:
      literal - a true literal
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable - if a contradiction occurs.

    • sortLiterals

      private void sortLiterals(Clause clause)
      sorts the literals in the clause. Literals are sorted according to their absolute values. If the first literal is negative, then all literals are inverted.
      Parameters:
      clause - a new clause

    • getRepresentative

      public int getRepresentative(int literal)
      maps literals to their representative in the equivalence class.
      Parameters:
      literal - a literal
      Returns:
      the literal or the representative of the literal's equivalence class.

    • getEClause

      public Clause getEClause(int literal)
      return the Equivalence clause which contains the literal (positive or negative)
      Parameters:
      literal - any literal
      Returns:
      null or the equivalence clause containing the literal (positive or negative)

    • completeModel

      public void completeModel() throws Unsatisfiable
      If a literal in an equivalence class is true, then all other literals are also made true This method is called when a partial model is found, which is supposed to be extendable to a complete model.
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable - if the resulting model becomes inconsistent (should never happen)

    • insertClause

      private void insertClause(Clause clause)
      inserts the clause into the local data structures.
      Parameters:
      clause - the clause to be inserted.

    • removeClause

      private void removeClause(Clause clause)
      removes a clause from the internal lists.
      Parameters:
      clause - a clause to be removed.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      checks if there is no equivalence class
      Returns:
      true if there is no equivalence class

    • toString

      public String toString()
      turns the equivalence classes into a string "literal1 = literal2 = ... = representative\n..."
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the equivalence classes.

    • toString

      turns the equivalence classes into a string "literal1 = literal2 = ... = representative\n..."
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a string representation of the equivalence classes.

    • toString

      public String toString(Symboltable symboltable, boolean info)
      turns the equivalence classes into a string "literal1 = literal2 = ... = representative\n..."
      Parameters:
      symboltable - or null
      info - if true then the origins are added.
      Returns:
      a string representation of the equivalence classes.

    • infoString

      public String infoString(Symboltable symboltable)
      turns the equivalence classes into a string "literal1[origins] = literal2[origins] = ... = representative"
      Parameters:
      symboltable - or null
      Returns:
      a string representation of the equivalence class with the origins.

    • check

      public void check(StringBuilder errors)
      checks the consistency of the data.
